3_1NzjwWNcVjsX1ndBgkgC1EM5EUzMACGm8L.body:
In Windows 10, in a terminal i go to the ZN folder and "zeroney.py --debug". I get the following error "

 File "C:\Users\Tomas\Desktop\ZeroBundle\ZeroNet\zeronet.py", line 9
    print "- Starting ZeroNet..."
                                                ^
SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'

4_1NzjwWNcVjsX1ndBgkgC1EM5EUzMACGm8L.body: Yes, the full screen problem is because ZN is programmed as an iframe sanboxed window with the full screen option disable for security reasons. Im trying to find a fix for this!

5_1NzjwWNcVjsX1ndBgkgC1EM5EUzMACGm8L.body: i want the hard way xD
Thanks, i wanted this finger point answer.

I had a while seeing the ZeroBlog source code and working with it, but cant figure it out. Can i have some help, i need a comment section to be add on every "content page" that will have my page, i cant use the blog template because my page wont have "posts" it will have little content links. I dont need the following functions, just auth, and leave a coment the same as a blog, i think this is possible and its easier than the things im trying out. I think the only information i need for the db is user_id (who comments), comment_id, content_id (content where comment is located), time when commented was posted . Can i have some help please? I ve been with this like 10hrs now :S
Think about a play website, when you pop up the movie windows, under the quality options, you could add a comment
